It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. programme.title: The Repair Shop

Plus, Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell arrive in Northumberland on the last leg of their tour. Phil takes a punt on an antique pump for the second time before coming face to face with a scarecrow made in his own image. Irita takes a painterly turn, fancying a French work of art and goes back to school Pre-Raphaelite-style in the model village of Ford, where she follows in the footsteps of little-known artist Lady Louisa Waterford

programme.title: Bridge of Lies

Meanwhile, Martha's restaurant is reviewed by an influential food critic as she misses an important IVF appointment and makes an important decision regarding plans to start a family. Detective drama set in rural Devon, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: The Cleaner

However, this proves to be the least of his problems when he is called upon to handle the devastation left by a lethal barroom brawl. As a web of romantic and criminal intrigue slowly unravels around him, he realises there's more to this job than just cleaning up blood and gore. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Harriet Walter and Charlie Rawes

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke and Giovanni Pernice embark on a tour of Giovanni's homeland Sicily, beginning in the port town of Sciacca. Their first stop is the Valley of the Temples, the remains of a huge Greek city featuring some of the best examples of classical Greek architecture anywhere in the world. From there, they hit the white beaches of Porta Bianca before taking in some more history in Syracuse. Today, it is just a provincial city, but more than 2,700 years ago it was one of the largest colonies in the ancient Greek world, and some of the original buildings remain inside the city's Archaeological Park. Their final stop is the island's second city Catania, a place very significant to Giovanni as he moved there aged 14 to further his dance career

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.desc: Ben Thompson and Sarah Campbell present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley visit Haddon Hall in Derbyshire, one of the UK's best preserved Medieval houses, to explore its hidden treasures, including a 12th century chapel, Elizabethan long gallery and Medieval kitchen. Kate also meets some of Haddon's Christian tour guides to hear about the history of the Hall and how their faith influences their work

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph appeals on behalf of Marie Curie, a charity providing care and support to people with a terminal illness, their families and anyone dealing with death and bereavement

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Manchester City v Chelsea (Kick-off 12.40pm). All the action from the clash at Academy Stadium. Chelsea have been the dominant force in this competition in recent years, winning four of the last five titles, but City look set to push them close this time around, with Manchester United and Arsenal making it a four-horse race

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a couple from Buckinghamshire who are looking for a detached property in Rutland with a garden big enough for a vegetable patch, all on their budget of 500,000. Continuing the horticultural theme, Steve visits Barnsdale Gardens to see for himself the legacy left by Geoff Hamilton, one of the country's best-loved gardeners

programme.title: The Boat Races
programme.desc: Live coverage of the annual men's and women's University Boat Races between Oxford and Cambridge on the River Thames. The 77th women's race gets under way at 4.00pm, followed by the start of the 168th men's race at 5.00pm

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley is in Aberystwyth to meet scientists behind some of the biggest new developments in farming and food security. Charlotte Smith is in the Lea Valley to investigate why what's known as London's Salad Bowl is on the brink of collapse. Adam Henson finds out why the shift towards sustainable farming could mean boom time for native breeds while Adrian Chiles discovers what the future of sheep farming could be in his final report from the Welsh mountains

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores Britain's grasslands, from flower meadows to the rich open landscapes of our mountains and reveals some extraordinary and dramatic wildlife stories. Featuring bees that lay their eggs in empty snail shells, brown hares performing spring boxing courtship routines, and how large blue butterflies have come back from the brink of extinction

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Sefton Park in Liverpool, where treasures include a medal given to one of the first men to land on D-Day, a dress by Swinging Sixties fashion designer Ossie Clark, and one of the first vials of penicillin. Fiona also meets the son of a Chinese immigrant and ship worker to discuss the history of the Chinese community in Liverpool

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Steven Knight's adaptation of Charles Dickens' classic novel about an orphan pursuing his desire for a greater lot in life. His life is changed forever first by an encounter with an escaped convict, and then again when he is summoned to the household of wealthy recluse Miss Havisham (Olivia Colman), who intends him to be the companion of her adopted daughter

programme.title: Darkest Hour (2017)
programme.desc: May 1940. As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Including highlights of Manchester City v Chelsea, Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal, Manchester United v West Ham United and Everton v Liverpool

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ashes-winning cricketer Steve Harmison, former Liverpool defender Stephen Warnock, snowboarding Winter Olympian Aimee Fuller and Rugby World Cup-winner Maggie Alphonsi join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explain how necessity often forced cooks to make the most of limited ingredients to create tasty dishes. They reveal that many popular meals were invented during hard times, from mince and dumplings to Scotch broths

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Jordan Banjo and Chris Bavin head to Manchester to meet Gaz and Amina White and their two young children. The couple both work in social services and juggling busy jobs means evenings in their house are a tale of two teatimes. Youngsters Lincoln and Elita get a delicious and nutritious home-cooked meal, whereas Gaz and Amina typically opt for pricey convenience food or takeaways. This lack of planning and reliance on expensive quick fixes is costing them time and money. Chris and Jordan try to encourage them to cook one meal for all and challenge all concerned to try new brands and new foods

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: Piers Taylor and Caroline Quentin explore bold and extraordinary homes in Spain, a country renowned for experimental and fearless architecture. They include a metal home in the foothills of the Pyrenees that is more like a piece of art, an architect's home in Madrid made of seven vast concrete and steel beams and a space-age circular building in the wilderness of Aragon

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Experts James Lewis and Jonathan Pratt assess items brought to Dover Castle in Kent, while presenter Paul Martin looks at the life of James Bond creator Ian Fleming

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall, Jodie Kidd, Jamali Maddix and Suzi Perry test their general knowledge skills, and the winner of the week's games is announced

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman go in search of tips and treats at the York Food Festival, including homemade hummus and the many surprising varieties of the English apple. Onkar Singh Purewal is on the hunt for healthy food the whole family will eat, Ryan Hand gets to grips with Japanese cuisine, and chef Julie Lin reveals some affordable seafood

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Architects Laura Jane Clark and Will Foster compete to remodel a couple's 1950s home in Belfast, with Lei Ying dreaming of a perfect kitchen, while her husband David hopes for a cosy home and a safe route to the garden. Angela Scanlon presents

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty Don gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Cambridgeshire and reveals how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. And Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Dorset

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Dangerous politics and turbulent love shock the painter's world - after conducting a short affair with Leon Trotsky, Diego's political mentor, Frida finally achieves her own solo exhibition in Europe. But all does not go according to plan, and she returns to Mexico to find that Diego wants a divorce

programme.title: Cunk on Britain
programme.desc: Philomena Cunk from Charlie Brooker's Weekly Wipe carries out in-depth investigations, travelling the length and breadth of the country and enlisting the help of a variety of experts. She begins by examining the origins of the universe, and interviews Robert Peston about British politics. Comedy documentary, starring Diane Morgan

programme.desc: When Pete and Omar lose their beloved grandmother, they go in search of Omar's estranged dad, confronting him on the day of his daughter's engagement party. Comedy, starring Antonio Aakeel, Jack Carroll (Britain's Got Talent) and Asim Chaudhry (People Just Do Nothing)

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: With pressure mounting as he records his debut album, Dave has some decisions to make about what he is willing to sacrifice. Comedy, starring Dave Burd

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: The parole board considers the cases of two serious offenders. Fifteen years ago, Matthew violently murdered a young woman on a public street. A recently converted Christian, he now has the chance to move to an open prison where he will come into contact with the public. After being convicted for arson, 26-year-old Simran was caught dealing class A drugs. Halfway through his four-and-a-half year sentence, he has the chance to be released into the community. Will his history of mental health problems compromise this opportunity?

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Upon discovering that his family has moved on in his absence, Stede vows to make things right with his wife, Mary. After a desperate attempt to stage a show for the crew, Izzy confronts a depressed Blackbeard about his former life

programme.desc: Emily from the Highlands is crazy about crochet and desperately needs a space where she can crochet to her heart's content, store all her woolly wonders and hang out with mates

programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Mwaksy and Abby join One Zoo Three brothers Cam, Aaron and Tyler at their zoo to hear all about their new series, OZT Goes Wild in Britain

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall looks at the world of reptiles and discovers what make them cold-blooded killers, and meets the largest lizard alive on the remote island of Komodo

programme.title: Queen of Katwe (2016)
programme.desc: In Kampala, Uganda, young Phiona finds surprising distraction from her life grafting in the Katwe slum when she is introduced to chess by youth worker Robert, and proves to be talented at it. Drama, starring David Oyelowo, Lupita Nyong'o and Madina Nalwanga

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: The remaining seven celebrity home cooks are put through their paces once more. First, Mary Berry challenges the contestants to make their ultimate burger and chips, before Chris Bavin reveals frozen peas as the secret ingredient that the celebrities must make the star of the dish for his rustle up challenge on day two. The three judges must then decide who will be cooking again in this week's eliminator challenge, following one of Angela's toughest recipes to date

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode continues his alphabetical journey, this time looking at dishes linked by the letter Q. The Little Paris Kitchen's Rachel Khoo cooks quiche Lorraine and Raymond Blanc demonstrates how to make a quail egg ravioli

programme.title: The Tommy Steele Story (1957)
programme.desc: Musical biopic of the 1950s teenage pop idol. Starring Steele as himself, with Lisa Daniely

programme.title: Jesus Christ Superstar (1973)
programme.desc: Musical following the last days in the life of Jesus Christ, seen from the perspective of the disciple Judas, who is gradually tempted into betraying his friend and sending him to his death. Based on the Andrew Lloyd Webber stage show and starring Ted Neeley, Carl Anderson, Yvonne Elliman and Barry Dennan

programme.title: Live Women's Six Nations
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 4.45pm). All the action from both teams' opening match of the championship, held at Kingston Park in Newcastle. England won the Grand Slam last year and went on to narrowly miss out on lifting the World Cup after a defeat at the hands of New Zealand in the final. In contrast, Scotland will be looking to make considerable improvements after losing all of their matches in last year's Six Nations

programme.title: The MI5 Spy and the IRA: Operation Chiffon
programme.desc: Award-winning journalist Peter Taylor reveals the extraordinary story of how a former undercover MI5 officer put his life and career on the line to encourage the IRA to end its violent campaign and embrace politics. The former MI5 officer, simply known as Robert, ran the top-secret back channel of communications between the UK government and the leadership of the IRA. What Robert did has been a closely guarded secret for three decades and was the key link in the chain that led to the Good Friday Agreement

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Dancing siblings AJ and Curtis Pritchard go toe to toe in a bid to win this competition. As they take to the roads of the west of Scotland, from Glasgow down to Ayrshire, they are partnered with porcelain experts Serhat Ahmet and Irita Marriot. Along the way, Strictly star AJ learns to ceilidh dance in Glasgow's oldest dancehall, while Curtis swaps the Love Island hot tub for one of Scotland's last public heated outdoor swimming pools

programme.title: Open All Hours: A Celebration
programme.desc: A documentary looking at the enduring appeal of the classic comedy, following the cast and crew as they returned to film a Christmas special at Arkwright's original shop in Doncaster, South Yorkshire - with scenes also fine-tuned at MediaCity in Salford. The programme includes interviews on set, including the thoughts of David Jason, Lynda Baron and writer Roy Clarke, and captures the communal excitement as the show returns to town for the first time in 28 years

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him, so nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason Granville First broadcast in March 1981

programme.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber at the BBC
programme.desc: To mark his 75th birthday, the composer takes a nostalgic journey through the BBC archives, looking back on a collection some of his biggest and best-loved songs, with performances by stars like Barbra Streisand, Elaine Paige, Diana Ross, Michael Ball and Michael Crawford. Andrew also shares stories from behind scenes of his most popular works, shedding light on how he knew Madonna would perform Evita years before she did, how the cast of Starlight Express ended up on roller-skates, and how Jason Donovan and his Technicolour Dream Coat had a new generation falling in love with musical theatre

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Having reigned over musical theatre for nearly five decades, Andrew Lloyd Webber's music has delighted millions worldwide in hit shows like Jesus Christ Superstar, Evita, Cats and Aspects of Love. In this programme, the composer chats to Alan Yentob about his autobiography Unmasked, a candid and confessional account of his early life and career up to the opening of The Phantom of the Opera in 1986

programme.title: Elaine Paige at the BBC
programme.desc: One of Britain's biggest and most enduring star of musical theatre, Elaine Paige has enjoyed success for more than four decades in the West End, on Broadway and on TV, radio and in the pop charts. This selection of some of her best-loved songs and finest performances on the BBC features Don't Cry for Me Argentina, Memory, and I Know Him So Well. There are also rarely seen archive gems from the earliest days of Elaine's career, and her own interpretations of many musical masterpieces from shows like Chess and Anything Goes

programme.title: Burning (2018)
programme.desc: Writer Jongsu crosses paths with Shin Hae-mi, a young woman who used to live in the same neighbourhood. After returning from a trip to Africa, she introduces Ben, a guy she met there, who raises Jongsu's suspicions. Director Lee Chang-dong's drama inspired by Haruki Murakami's short story Barn Burning, starring Ah-in Yoo, Steven Yeun and Jong-seo Jun. In Korean

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty Don gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Cambridgeshire and reveals how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. And Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Dorset

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani meet volunteers doing conservation work on the River Wye, including creating a 30-acre wetland to harbour some of the river's most cherished wildlife. Adam Henson meets the farmer trying to do his bit to save the river, Tom Heap investigates why the Wye has been allowed to decline close to the point of being declared ecologically dead, and Adrian Chiles is in North Wales discovering what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Nick Hewer, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Scarlett Moffatt, Monty Panesar, Louisa Clein and Shazia Mirza are on their final day in Derry Londonderry, when the delayed seventh participant arrives. Jetting in from the Paralympics in Japan, table tennis star Will Bayley completes the pilgrim band. Eventually they leave Northern Ireland behind them and set sail across the North Channel to western Scotland and join the Kintyre Way

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: At mainland Wales' most northerly point in Flintshire, Derek Brockway's latest walk starts off at the site of the Point of Ayr Colliery at the mouth of the Dee estuary. There, Derek meets John Wiltshire, who is passionate about keeping the memory of the mine alive. Derek lends a hand, helping endangered species in the sand dunes, and little terns who nest on the beach just over the Denbighshire border. Around 10 miles on, in 'Sunny Rhyl', Derek learns to kitesurf and do the surfers' shaka

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman check out the food and festivities on offer at Belfast's Mela Festival, from Korean kimchi and Jamaican patties. Baker Briony-May Williams finds out why Cumbria is the home of sticky toffee pudding, farmer Meinir Howells gets a workout harvesting cockles in Carmarthenshire, and farmer Jim Smith raises a glass to non-alcoholic beer, wine and spirits

programme.title: Sam and Shauna's Big Cook Out
programme.desc: Barbecue chefs Samantha Evans and Shauna Guinn travel around Wales to create huge outdoor feasts to reward the work of a variety of organisations and individuals. They begin by celebrating football club Barry Town United's promotion to the Welsh Premier League, including cooking a whole pig, Hawaiian-style, in a huge brick fire pit, to be served with pit beans, cornbread and an apple and fennel slaw, with fruit-filled toffee apples for dessert

programme.title: Sam and Shauna's Big Cook Out
programme.desc: Samantha Evans and Shauna Guinn celebrate the achievements of Clwyd Special Riding School in North Wales with a big cook-out. With more than 100 people to feed, Sam and Shauna organise a menu of 10 huge beef briskets, barbecued in giant cinder-block smoker, built with the help of the community

programme.title: The First Great Train Robbery (1978)
programme.desc: An accomplished gentleman crook and a master safecracker hatch a plan to rob a British Army payroll train carrying a fortune in gold bullion, destined for the troops fighting in the Crimea. British period thriller, based on director Michael Crichton's own novel, starring Sean Connery, Donald Sutherland, Lesley-Anne Down, Alan Webb, Michael Elphick and Wayne Sleep

programme.title: Figure Skating
programme.desc: Katherine Downes presents action from Saitama, Japan, where ice dance duo Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson were hoping to win Britain's first World Championship medal for 39 years. With analysis from Robin Cousins

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The designers head to Scotland for their next challenge, making-over a hotel room at a five-star golf and spa resort with just two days and a budget of 2,000. Half of the competitors are given a brief for a maximalist design for the hotel's more outdoorsy guests, while the others must create a tranquil space for those looking for a relaxing spa visit. With a double elimination looming, the designers pull out all the tricks they have up their sleeves to impress Alan, Michelle and guest judge Matthew Williamson

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: Five teams race 16,000 kilometres across the breadth of Canada starting from Vancouver on the Pacific coastline and passing through seven checkpoints before reaching St Johns on the island of Newfoundland, the most easterly town in North America. Their skill, ingenuity and determination are put to the test as they embark on their journey without access to smartphones, the internet or credit cards. Armed with only the cash equivalent of the airfare to fly their route, the teams travel at ground level through some of the most remote regions in the world

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Axon value items brought to Althorp House in Northamptonshire, where Christina is drawn to a 1950s toy pedal car and Will finds a Mouseman tray. Plus, Paul Martin discovers that the Grand Union was the canal equivalent of the M1

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Giles Coren and Monica Galetti travel to Madeira, famous for its year-round spring-like weather, to work in one of Europe's greatest hotels, Reid's Palace. Giles irons bedspreads in a suite once loved by Winston Churchill, and Monica cleans crabs out of the historic tidal swimming pool

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc: The captain of HMS Queen Elizabeth deliberately seeks out the worst possible weather so he can test how the F35 jets cope under extreme conditions - and gets his wish when the aircraft carrier ends up in the path of a hurricane. After consulting with his officers, he resolves to brave the elements and test the jets to the brink of destruction. The crew also faces the challenge of refueling the vessel at sea - one of the hardest tasks outside of going into battle

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: After spending the early 2000s perched on the high horse of respectability politics, Bill Cosby falls from grace with two trials, a conviction, incarceration, appeal - and in 2021 - an overturned verdict. W Kamau Bell asks what this means for people's attitudes to his previous work and the larger systemic problems Cosby's story lays bare

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz the theme of animals that begin with the letter T, with guests Hannah Waddingham, Desiree Burch and Jason Manford joining regular Alan Davies

programme.title: The Cockfields
programme.desc: Simon is persuaded to mark the occasion of his 40th birthday back at the Cockfield family home, so takes his girlfriend Donna along to the Isle of Wight. The duo soon find themselves spending a long weekend as guests of his ever-doting mother Sue and controlling stepfather Ray, together with their menagerie of relatives and friends. Comedy, starring Joe Wilkinson, Diane Morgan, Sue Johnston and Bobby Ball

programme.title: The Holy Land and Us: Our Untold Stories
programme.desc: Rob Rinder and Sarah Agha conclude their investigation into how their own and other families' histories were impacted by the founding of the state of Israel in 1948. They are joined by a woman who wants to find out why, when she was a child, her aunts left Egypt for the new state of Israel, and a woman who wants to know what happened to her family as her grandfather struggled to hold on to his land and orange groves in Jaffa

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Dangerous politics and turbulent love shock the painter's world - after conducting a short affair with Leon Trotsky, Diego's political mentor, Frida finally achieves her own solo exhibition in Europe. But all does not go according to plan, and she returns to Mexico to find that Diego wants a divorce

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Staffordshire, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Newcastle-under-Lyme to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: The Mormons Are Coming
programme.desc: Following three young missionaries through training, as they give up their names and become Elders and Sisters who live under a strict time table with limited contact with family, will any of them go the distance? This documentary brings a unique insight into who the Mormons are from young believers who are passionate about their faith

programme.desc: Mark Goodier hosts the chart show from May 26, 1994, featuring music by the Prodigy, Maxx, Carleen Anderson, Bruce Dickinson, Gloworm, Pet Shop Boys with Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, Galliano, All-4-One and the Manchester United Football Club squad

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Richard Skinner introduces performances by Graham Bonnet, Hazel O'Connor, Tony Capstick, Gillan, Lene Lovich, Bad Manners, Shakin Stevens, Linx, Landscape, the Polecats and Kim Wilde. First shown on March 26, 1981

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Janice Long and Simon Bates present an edition first aired on 20 March, featuring performances by Jim Diamond, Pet Shop Boys, Cliff Richard and the Young Ones, the Real Thing, Diana Ross and Mr Mister

programme.title: Dolly Parton at the BBC

This collection showcases the enduring songwriting talents and sense of humour that first made Dolly's name back in the 1970s

programme.title: Dolly Parton: Here I Am
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of the acclaimed songwriter, which invites viewers to get to know the real Dolly Parton, the woman behind the global phenomenon. The feature-length documentary, directed by Francis Whately, takes the audience on a musical journey through some of her greatest songs, including The Bridge, I Will Always Love You, and 9 To 5. Cameras also capture Dolly celebrating the 50th anniversary of her very first performance at the Grand Ole Opry, and features unprecedented access to the singer herself, as well as collaborators from throughout her career

programme.title: Glastonbury 2014
programme.desc: The country singer's complete set on the Pyramid stage at Worthy Farm in the now-traditional legends spot on Sunday afternoon, featuring Jolene, Coat of Many Colours, 9 to 5, Islands in the Stream and I Will Always Love You

programme.title: Country Queens at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of archive performances by female country-music stars from a variety of BBC studio shows. Featured acts include Bobbie Gentry, Anne Murray, Emmylou Harris, Taylor Swift, Crystal Gayle, Tammy Wynette, Billie Jo Spears, and Lucinda Williams with Mary Chapin Carpenter

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier hosts the chart show from May 26, 1994, featuring music by the Prodigy, Maxx, Carleen Anderson, Bruce Dickinson, Gloworm, Pet Shop Boys with Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, Galliano, All-4-One and the Manchester United Football Club squad

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Another selection of music performances from 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: Michael Palin: The Art of Travel
programme.desc: Michael discovers that the Great Western Railway had the most sophisticated public relations machine of all the railway companies between the two World Wars, producing high-quality publications and promotional gimmicks

programme.title: Michael Palin's Hemingway Adventure
programme.desc: The journey progresses from the author's birthplace in the American Midwest to northern Michigan, where the intrepid adventurer spends a few hours trying his hand at fishing and shooting _ as Hemingway did as a child _ before following the spirited young man's path across the Atlantic into Europe

programme.title: Michael Palin: Travels of a Lifetime
programme.desc: Michael Palin looks back on the making of Pole to Pole, in which he travelled along a single line of longitude across the USSR, Africa and finally into Antarctica. Along the way, he paid a visit to Chernobyl and gained an insight into the last days of the Soviet Union. His travels across Africa led to an encounter with some fellow globetrotters from his home town of Sheffield - but he was forced to make a detour when his planned route passed through a war zone

programme.title: Luzzu (2021)
programme.desc: A man risks everything to provide for his wife and newborn son by entering Malta's black-market fishing industry. Drama, starring Jesmark Scicluna, Marlene Schranz and David Scicluna. In Maltese and English

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: First episode of the black comedy written by and starring Julia Davis. Manipulative beauty salon owner Jill responds to the news of her husband's cancer diagnosis by pretending that he has already died, hoping to enjoy the sympathy for being a widow and seduce her new neighbour. With Angus Deayton and Kevin Eldon

programme.title: Nighty Night
programme.desc: Jill continues to ignore Terry's phone calls and she invites Don over for a dinner of smashed prawns in a milky basket, but her plans are thwarted when his wife Cath turns up. Comedy, starring Julia Davis and Angus Deayton

programme.title: As Time Goes By

programme.title: Paris Police 1900

programme.title: Michael Palin's Hemingway Adventure
programme.desc: The journey progresses from the author's birthplace in the American Midwest to northern Michigan, where the intrepid adventurer spends a few hours trying his hand at fishing and shooting _ as Hemingway did as a child _ before following the spirited young man's path across the Atlantic into Europe

programme.title: Francesco's Italy Top to Toe
programme.desc: Author and architect Francesco da Mosto presents a guide to his native Italy. He starts in the North, where he views Leonardo's Last Supper in Milan and explores one of the world's oldest universities. He also visits Florence, the birthplace of Renaissance art, and Verona, the setting for Romeo and Juliet, before going underwater to see the statue of Christ off the coast of Portofino

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc: A look at the career of Daniel Barenboim through his regular presence on the BBC including performances with his first wife Jacqueline du Pr, intimate chamber music, solo recitals, masterclasses and epic orchestral concerts

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Antiques Roadshow's Paul Atterbury recalls the heyday of the great ocean liners, travelling round Britain to reveal a story of design, politics and tragedy as he finds out how these great ships captured the public's imagination. Along the way he uncovers a cinema in Scotland built from the interiors of the SS Homeric, and visits a house in Poole, Dorset, where cabins from the Mauretania have been preserved

programme.title: The Secret Life of Books
programme.desc: Documentary series exploring classic works of fiction, continuing with TV script writer Tony Jordan examining Charles Dickens' popular novel Great Expectations. He investigates why the author changed the ending of the book, and asks what this tells the reader about the writer. Plus, the original texts and manuscripts are examined, which offer clues about the novelist's troubled life, and may have influenced whether Pip would have a future with Estella in the story

programme.title: Loyle Carner at 6 Music Festival 2023

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Shanghai
programme.desc: In a programme filmed in May 1989, Clive set out to find out about a city that was once known as the Paris of the East and discovered China on the brink of revolution. As demonstrating students joined three million cyclists to clog the streets, he encounters a once-wealthy socialite who survived the Cultural Revolution, a baby-washing entrepreneur, a local eel-gutter and a jazz band playing Jingle Bells on an empty ferry cruising up the Huangpu River

programme.title: The Toddler Club
programme.desc: Nigel, Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear welcome toddlers Freddie, Dylan, William and Afal, and their grown-ups to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! The What's in the Box? game reveals a wooden toy aeroplane, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are all inspired by an 'in the air' theme. This subject is explored through exploration, play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate 'in the air' object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler. Storytime is all about joining in with physical actions, as Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear are given a kite as a present. The twins go outside to fly it, but things don't quite go to plan when the kite gets stuck in a tree! Viewers at home show how they've been exploring the 'in the air' theme too. Plus, the Big Band Song

programme.desc: Bitz is desperate for famous chef,Madame Gourmet to taste her yummy Bitz mix marmalade

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: It is Babysitting Day and Love Monster looks after a baby koala, but finds it hard work

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: LM trades in his old scooter for a shiny new one, but he soon misses it

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Ubercorn gets trapped inside and icy mountain

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Cartoon following four adventure-seeking superheroes as they explore places all around the world

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: Dog loves the smell of books, the sound of them, and most of all, he loves the stories inside them

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: The class makes a dragon costume and Timmy wants to be the head

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends visit a zoo, where they meet pandas, lemurs and elephants! Meanwhile, Tumble Cottage ends up full of animals when all the teddies have play dates.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Green arrives, bringing her natural colour to Colourland. Learn about the colour green.

programme.title: Pablo
programme.desc: A little boy journeys from real-life into the animated art world he creates, where his friends help him handle situations that make him feel anxious

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Rainbow gets to experience the night for the first time

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: It's the Great OKIDO Cake Off! In his enthusiasm, Messy accidentally ruins everyone's cakes. Will he be able to follow the recipe and bake a cake in time for Gloria's 80th birthday party?

programme.title: Grace's Amazing Machines
programme.desc: Grace uses a roller to flatten a road, shows off a giant bucket-wheel excavator, and uses a telescopic loader to move some bricks up high

programme.title: Andy's Global Adventures
programme.desc: Andy, Jen and Scout discover how blue-eyed black lemurs in Madagascar deal with bugs

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits Theatre, its Strawberry, who used to be insecure, but now cant wait to celebrate herself and sing her song, See the Seeds!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels go out for a walk but can't find a way back to the clubhouse. Through a series of unusual methods, the Squirrels learn all about direction and how to find their way to the clubhouse.

programme.title: Magic Hands
programme.desc: Donna wonders what it would be like to be an animal and Simon decides he wants to be an owl

programme.title: Treasure Champs
programme.desc: Barry hogs all the toys, leaving Kari nothing to play with but a small pebble. However, when Kari turns it into a super toy character, she shows generosity by sharing it with Barry

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea traps Supertato and demands he tell her the secret of his superstrength. Supertato escapes and tells Evil Pea that his friends give him his strength.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Muffin plays the game of library her way

programme.title: Andy's Global Adventures
programme.desc: Andy, Jen and Scout go on a global adventure to California in search of grizzly bears

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Tinks is a disability assistance dog for her owner Charli, who has a condition that makes it painful for her to pick things up or to push and pull things. Tinks uses her superfetch skills to help Charli every day. The smallest of the Dog Squad gang, Tinks is a little Lhasa Apso with lots of big dog energy. Charli has been invited to a party but is feeling a bit nervous about going. Tinks loves helping Charli feel confident. She wants to help Charli feel good about herself so she can go and have fun at the party. Tinks fetches Charlis hair brush so Charli can brush her newly-dyed pink hair, and then helps Charli choose a party outfit. And, when Charli cant find her keys, Tinks dives into a mountain of clothes on the bed to search for them. Now theyre party ready, but it's raining! Tinks is determined to help Charli get to the party, even in the rain. But how? She summons all her big dog energy and sets off in search of a plan. Just wait until Dog Squad hear about this!

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran are at a busy train station when JoJo realises Panda is missing! The pair decide to retrace their steps through the station - where could Panda be?

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: When Sarah and Duck's favourite bench is in use, the pair find other things to do in the park

programme.title: Charlie and Lola
programme.desc: Lola is a very fussy eater, she won't eat mushrooms, or peas or fishfingers or tomatoes. Charlie encourages her to change her diet

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: A little Hoot lands on the planet and causes mayhem with his incessant mischievous hooting. The Clangers decide it has to go home, but with the Hoot Planet so far away how can they attract its attention? Luckily, Major has just invented a make-it-louder machine that does the job perfectly. Michael Palin narrates

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos have a busy day riding on the Pinky Ponk and exploring the garden

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Dame Kristin Scott Thomas reads tonight's bedtime story about a girl who loves the stars and space.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Charlie Stayt and Naga Munchetty present a round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones co-hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerly appeal for information from the public about crimes around the country

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Cameras observe Avon & Somerset police officers working the night-time shift. Plus, a North Wales PC talks about the difficulties faced as a minority in the force

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Kingston-upon-Hull to see a two-bedroom end-of-terrace bought by an experienced developer. Martin Roberts is in Derby to see a three-storey Victorian house that has been split into two separate flats and in Gillingham, Kent, to check out a two-bedroom mid-terrace

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion hosts the latest contest in Leominster, Herefordshire, where Kate Bliss and Ochucko Ojiri are helping the teams, and Christina learns about tribal art

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: nspector Finn and new detective Al attend the scene of a shooting - an event unheard of in sleepy Port Devine - after a bullet is fired through retired headmaster Eugene McManners' front door. Meanwhile, Marlene goes the extra mile for her best friend Nicole, alienating step-dad Barry in the process

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Stained glass expert Matthew Nickels pieces together a damaged glass picture window depicting a colourful boat at sea. Made by the owner's late father, it has a great deal of sentimental value. Meanwhile, leather expert Suzie Fletcher turns her attention to three iconic leather sling back Les Arcs chairs desperately in need of some love and attention to make them usable again. Plus, Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor is in on a property trek around rural Shropshire, helping her house hunters with 425,000 to find a country home that they will hopefully fall in love with and buy. Margherita also delves into the county's industrial past with a trip to the Ironbridge Gorge, where she discovers the speed and skill needed to cut it as a clay pipe maker back in the 19th century

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell arrive in Northumberland on the last leg of their tour. Phil takes a punt on an antique pump for the second time before coming face to face with a scarecrow made in his own image. Irita takes a painterly turn, fancying a French work of art and goes back to school Pre-Raphaelite-style in the model village of Ford, where she follows in the footsteps of little-known artist Lady Louisa Waterford

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Family members Elisha, Emma, Georgia and Paul compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the prize. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas chat to studio guests, while a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: Truckers: Life on the Road
programme.desc: Radio DJ and trucking enthusiast Jagger is put through his paces by instructor Will as he prepares for his Class 1 HGV test. Newly qualified driver Laura may have her HGV test behind her, but she still has challenges to overcome. Today she faces her nemesis - the most complex intersection on the British road system, serving 18 routes on five different levels, otherwise known as Spaghetti Junction

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Reports of strange lights in the sky above North Farm lead ramblers to a newly appeared crop circle where they find an unidentified man's body. Humphrey finds himself at pains to suppress conspiracy theorists speculating alien involvement while methodically pursuing the case. Meanwhile, Martha's restaurant is reviewed by an influential food critic as she misses an important IVF appointment and makes an important decision regarding plans to start a family. Detective drama set in rural Devon, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A celebration of one of football's most talented players, from his early days as a promising young prospect to his rise to fame with Tottenham and his record-breaking transfer to Real Madrid. This documentary offers and inside look into his life and career

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Crime scene cleanser Wicky faces the ultimate test of self-control - a job in a pub just after he's promised his new girlfriend to stay off the booze. However, this proves to be the least of his problems when he is called upon to handle the devastation left by a lethal barroom brawl. As a web of romantic and criminal intrigue slowly unravels around him, he realises there's more to this job than just cleaning up blood and gore. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Harriet Walter and Charlie Rawes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love (1998)
programme.desc: The Elizabethan dramatist suffers from writer's block while working on his new play, and to make matters worse creditors are about to close down the theatre. But when a noblewoman disguises herself as a man to fulfil her dream of appearing on stage, the Bard becomes enchanted by her and is inspired to pen the most famous love story of all time. Comedy, with Joseph Fiennes, Gwyneth Paltrow, Judi Dench, Ben Affleck, Geoffrey Rush, Martin Clunes and Tom Wilkinson

programme.title: Scrum V Live
programme.desc: Wales v Ireland (Kick-off 2.15pm). Catrin Heledd presents all the action from the opening match of the championship, held at Cardiff Arms Park. Wales prevailed 27-19 when the teams met in Dublin last year and they will be looking to better their third-place finish, one spot above the Irish, this time around. With analysis from Siwan Lillicrap, Dyddgu Hywel, Philippa Tuttiett and Sene Naoupu

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: EastEnders actor Ricky Groves, comedian Harriet Kemsley, Made in Chelsea star Verity Bowditch and writer Bonnie Greer are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on James Bond Themes, Sloths, Sir David Attenborough and Hattie McDaniel

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees Gareth Malone, Stephen Bailey, Mwaka Mudenda, and Ore Oduba taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Chris Hoy, Georgia Toffolo, Robert Peston, Snoochie Shy, Bez, Dr Zoe Williams and Joel Dommett

programme.title: Big Night of Musicals 2023 by the National Lottery
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts a special concert featuring performances from the casts of some of the most popular musicals in the West End, from Manchester AO Arena. Performances include Lin-Manuel Miranda's Hamilton, Les Misrables, MAMMA MIA!, We Will Rock You the Musical, Wicked, The Royal Shakespeare Company's Matilda The Musical, Disney's Newsies, Shrek the Musical UK and Ireland tour, Six the Musical, Ain't Too Proud - The Life And Times of The Temptations, The Bodyguard The Musical, and Rodgers & Hammerstein's The King and I. There will also be a special performance from Aspects Of Love, featuring musical theatre star Michael Ball

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Dylan fights to bring an abuser to justice, Jacob finally faces his guilt, and is there more to Faith's dishonest patient than meets the eye?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day Wales
programme.desc: Croatia v Wales. Jason Mohammad presents action from the Euro 2024 Group D qualifier at Stadion Poljud. With analysis from Joe Ledley and Danny Gabbidon

programme.title: Game Night (2018)
programme.desc: M ax and Annie hold regular games nights for their friends, but find themselves upstaged by Max's overbearing brother, who invites the group to his murder mystery party. However, the evening proves far more dangerous than expected when the host is unexpectedly kidnapped by gangsters. Black comedy, starring Jason Bateman, Rachel McAdams, Billy Magnussen and Sharon Horgan

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke and Giovanni Pernice embark on a tour of Giovanni's homeland Sicily, beginning in the port town of Sciacca. Their first stop is the Valley of the Temples, the remains of a huge Greek city featuring some of the best examples of classical Greek architecture anywhere in the world. From there, they hit the white beaches of Porta Bianca before taking in some more history in Syracuse. Today, it is just a provincial city, but more than 2,700 years ago it was one of the largest colonies in the ancient Greek world, and some of the original buildings remain inside the city's Archaeological Park. Their final stop is the island's second city Catania, a place very significant to Giovanni as he moved there aged 14 to further his dance career

programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Politics Wales
programme.desc: The latest political news and debate, and reports from around Wales

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley visit Haddon Hall in Derbyshire, one of the UK's best preserved Medieval houses, to explore its hidden treasures, including a 12th century chapel, Elizabethan long gallery and Medieval kitchen. Kate also meets some of Haddon's Christian tour guides to hear about the history of the Hall and how their faith influences their work

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph appeals on behalf of Marie Curie, a charity providing care and support to people with a terminal illness, their families and anyone dealing with death and bereavement

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Manchester City v Chelsea (Kick-off 12.40pm). All the action from the clash at Academy Stadium. Chelsea have been the dominant force in this competition in recent years, winning four of the last five titles, but City look set to push them close this time around, with Manchester United and Arsenal making it a four-horse race

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Steve Brown helps a couple from Buckinghamshire who are looking for a detached property in Rutland with a garden big enough for a vegetable patch, all on their budget of 500,000. Continuing the horticultural theme, Steve visits Barnsdale Gardens to see for himself the legacy left by Geoff Hamilton, one of the country's best-loved gardeners

programme.title: The Boat Races
programme.desc: Live coverage of the annual men's and women's University Boat Races between Oxford and Cambridge on the River Thames. The 77th women's race gets under way at 4.00pm, followed by the start of the 168th men's race at 5.00pm

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley is in Aberystwyth to meet scientists behind some of the biggest new developments in farming and food security. Charlotte Smith is in the Lea Valley to investigate why what's known as London's Salad Bowl is on the brink of collapse. Adam Henson finds out why the shift towards sustainable farming could mean boom time for native breeds while Adrian Chiles discovers what the future of sheep farming could be in his final report from the Welsh mountains

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores Britain's grasslands, from flower meadows to the rich open landscapes of our mountains and reveals some extraordinary and dramatic wildlife stories. Featuring bees that lay their eggs in empty snail shells, brown hares performing spring boxing courtship routines, and how large blue butterflies have come back from the brink of extinction

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Sefton Park in Liverpool, where treasures include a medal given to one of the first men to land on D-Day, a dress by Swinging Sixties fashion designer Ossie Clark, and one of the first vials of penicillin. Fiona also meets the son of a Chinese immigrant and ship worker to discuss the history of the Chinese community in Liverpool

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Steven Knight's adaptation of Charles Dickens' classic novel about an orphan pursuing his desire for a greater lot in life. His life is changed forever first by an encounter with an escaped convict, and then again when he is summoned to the household of wealthy recluse Miss Havisham (Olivia Colman), who intends him to be the companion of her adopted daughter

programme.title: Darkest Hour (2017)
programme.desc: May 1940. As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Including highlights of Manchester City v Chelsea, Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal, Manchester United v West Ham United and Everton v Liverpool

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: In East Lothian, Sarah Moore explores Wallyford Recycling Centre determined to save quality items from hitting the skips. There's a collection of teak architraves earmarked for lighting designer Duncan McKean, a sewing machine table in need of attention is sent to newcomer Martin Hough, and Sarah needs to come up with a creative use for an assortment of fabric before trying to sell the items on for a profit

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: The wildlife of Britain's woodlands through the seasons, including a look at how the reintroduction of wild boar to the Forest of Dean has helped robins to find food in winter. Plus, a look at how a subterranean network of fungi connects the whole forest together

programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley is in Aberystwyth to meet scientists behind some of the biggest new developments in farming and food security. Charlotte Smith is in the Lea Valley to investigate why what's known as London's Salad Bowl is on the brink of collapse. Adam Henson finds out why the shift towards sustainable farming could mean boom time for native breeds while Adrian Chiles discovers what the future of sheep farming could be in his final report from the Welsh mountains

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores Britain's grasslands, from flower meadows to the rich open landscapes of our mountains and reveals some extraordinary and dramatic wildlife stories. Featuring bees that lay their eggs in empty snail shells, brown hares performing spring boxing courtship routines, and how large blue butterflies have come back from the brink of extinction

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Sefton Park in Liverpool, where treasures include a medal given to one of the first men to land on D-Day, a dress by Swinging Sixties fashion designer Ossie Clark, and one of the first vials of penicillin. Fiona also meets the son of a Chinese immigrant and ship worker to discuss the history of the Chinese community in Liverpool

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Steven Knight's adaptation of Charles Dickens' classic novel about an orphan pursuing his desire for a greater lot in life. His life is changed forever first by an encounter with an escaped convict, and then again when he is summoned to the household of wealthy recluse Miss Havisham (Olivia Colman), who intends him to be the companion of her adopted daughter

programme.title: Darkest Hour (2017)
programme.desc: May 1940. As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Including highlights of Manchester City v Chelsea, Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal, Manchester United v West Ham United and Everton v Liverpool

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ashes-winning cricketer Steve Harmison, former Liverpool defender Stephen Warnock, snowboarding Winter Olympian Aimee Fuller and Rugby World Cup-winner Maggie Alphonsi join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones co-hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerly appeal for information from the public about crimes around the country

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: Cameras observe Avon & Somerset police officers working the night-time shift. Plus, a North Wales PC talks about the difficulties faced as a minority in the force

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Kingston-upon-Hull to see a two-bedroom end-of-terrace bought by an experienced developer. Martin Roberts is in Derby to see a three-storey Victorian house that has been split into two separate flats and in Gillingham, Kent, to check out a two-bedroom mid-terrace

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion hosts the latest contest in Leominster, Herefordshire, where Kate Bliss and Ochucko Ojiri are helping the teams, and Christina learns about tribal art

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: nspector Finn and new detective Al attend the scene of a shooting - an event unheard of in sleepy Port Devine - after a bullet is fired through retired headmaster Eugene McManners' front door. Meanwhile, Marlene goes the extra mile for her best friend Nicole, alienating step-dad Barry in the process

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Stained glass expert Matthew Nickels pieces together a damaged glass picture window depicting a colourful boat at sea. Made by the owner's late father, it has a great deal of sentimental value. Meanwhile, leather expert Suzie Fletcher turns her attention to three iconic leather sling back Les Arcs chairs desperately in need of some love and attention to make them usable again. Plus, Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor is in on a property trek around rural Shropshire, helping her house hunters with 425,000 to find a country home that they will hopefully fall in love with and buy. Margherita also delves into the county's industrial past with a trip to the Ironbridge Gorge, where she discovers the speed and skill needed to cut it as a clay pipe maker back in the 19th century

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Phil Serrell arrive in Northumberland on the last leg of their tour. Phil takes a punt on an antique pump for the second time before coming face to face with a scarecrow made in his own image. Irita takes a painterly turn, fancying a French work of art and goes back to school Pre-Raphaelite-style in the model village of Ford, where she follows in the footsteps of little-known artist Lady Louisa Waterford

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Family members Elisha, Emma, Georgia and Paul compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the prize. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Social Democratic and Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas chat to studio guests, while a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: Farm to Feast: Best Menu Wins
programme.desc: Eamonn Holmes returns with the cookery competition in which seven amateur cooks move into a castle in Fermanagh, where they live with and compete against each other. The first round begins with a reveal of two key ingredients - the distinctive Bramley apple from Armagh and award-winning Dexter beef from Co Down. From these, the contestants must create a menu for one small and one large dish. Michelin star chef Danni Barry and food critic Joris Minne blind select their favourite three menus - determining the three cooks who will battle it out in the kitchen for a place in the semi-final

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: Reports of strange lights in the sky above North Farm lead ramblers to a newly appeared crop circle where they find an unidentified man's body. Humphrey finds himself at pains to suppress conspiracy theorists speculating alien involvement while methodically pursuing the case. Meanwhile, Martha's restaurant is reviewed by an influential food critic as she misses an important IVF appointment and makes an important decision regarding plans to start a family. Detective drama set in rural Devon, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Stephen Bailey and Asim Chaudhry, reality star Gemma Collins and actress Sally Lindsay join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: The Cleaner
programme.desc: Crime scene cleanser Wicky faces the ultimate test of self-control - a job in a pub just after he's promised his new girlfriend to stay off the booze. However, this proves to be the least of his problems when he is called upon to handle the devastation left by a lethal barroom brawl. As a web of romantic and criminal intrigue slowly unravels around him, he realises there's more to this job than just cleaning up blood and gore. Dark comedy, starring Greg Davies, with Harriet Walter and Charlie Rawes

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Keepin' 'Er Country: On the Road Again
programme.desc: Documentary featuring Irish country music stars as they go out on tour in the wake of the pandemic. The opening programme focuses on Derek Ryan and Lisa McHugh as they get ready to take to the stage for the annual Farmers' Bash - a sold-out show at a major venue. Derek is one of the biggest names on the country music scene and his string of hits and number one albums means he is a massive draw for fans of all ages. Lisa raised her new-born son during the cessation of live music, but is now getting used to uggling childcare and her touring schedule

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ashes-winning cricketer Steve Harmison, former Liverpool defender Stephen Warnock, snowboarding Winter Olympian Aimee Fuller and Rugby World Cup-winner Maggie Alphonsi join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim is invited to parliament to take part in a Select Committee for the new disability funding act, but when Lily shows up and gets him thrown out, he swears revenge. Idris' mum visits to keep an eye on his new business venture but she turns out to be an alt-right conspiracy theorist who sets out on a crusade to turn his bookshop into a temple of bigotry

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Lily's latest scam is at risk when Tim runs into his nemesis Kiefer. Idris is roped into keeping the scam alive but is slowly broken down by Aaliyah's doom and Ruth's insults leading him to embrace the darkness. Can Tim save the day?

programme.title: Barra on the Foyle
programme.desc: Barra Best makes a journey across the river network, meeting people who work, live and play along its banks,and exploring places and landscapes rarely seen on TV screens

programme.title: Anton & Giovanni's Adventures in Sicily
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing stars Anton Du Beke and Giovanni Pernice embark on a tour of Giovanni's homeland Sicily, beginning in the port town of Sciacca. Their first stop is the Valley of the Temples, the remains of a huge Greek city featuring some of the best examples of classical Greek architecture anywhere in the world. From there, they hit the white beaches of Porta Bianca before taking in some more history in Syracuse. Today, it is just a provincial city, but more than 2,700 years ago it was one of the largest colonies in the ancient Greek world, and some of the original buildings remain inside the city's Archaeological Park. Their final stop is the island's second city Catania, a place very significant to Giovanni as he moved there aged 14 to further his dance career

programme.title: The Gold: The Inside Story
programme.desc: The true story of Britain's biggest bullion heist, featuring the personal accounts of the police officers who investigated the 1983 robbery at the Brink's-Mat security depot. Speaking for the first time since the robbery, Detective Chief Superintendent Brian Boyce and DC Tony Yeoman reveal the challenges they faced, the strategy they took and the tragedy that unfolded as they staked out Kenneth Noye, one of the men at the epicentre of the gang transforming the gold into cash

programme.desc: Live coverage of the day's proceedings in the House of Commons including the remaining stages of the Protection from Sex-based Harassment in Public Bill, the Ballot Secrecy Bill, the Workers (Predictable Terms and Conditions) Bill, the Veterans Advisory and Pensions Committees Bill and the Pensions (Extension of Automatic Enrolment) Bill.

programme.title: House of Lords
programme.desc: Business in the House of Lords including the third readings of the Mobile Hones (Pitch Fees) Bill and the Universal Credit (Removal of Two Child Limit) Bill as well as the second readings of the Co-operatives, Mutuals and Friendly Societies Bill. the Neonatal Care (Leave and Pay) Bill, the Shark Fins Bill and the Worker Protection (Amendment of Equality Act 2010) Bill, from Friday 24 March.

programme.title: Witness History
programme.desc: Witness History's Farhana Haider is at the People's History Museum in Manchester looking back at five extraordinary campaigns and protest movements headed by women, including the South Asian women workers who led a strike against poor working conditions in a British factory. We also speak to one of the women fighting for the equal right to pray at the Western Wall in Jerusalem. We meet the forensic anthropologist in Argentina who founded a team dedicated to digging for evidence of crimes against humanity. In Canada, we speak to one of the Mohawk activists who spent months in a stand-off with the country's military over plans to develop a golf course on sacred burial ground. Plus, how an anti-war march turned into a peace camp that endured for nearly 20 years outside an American air base in rural England.

programme.title: Port

programme.title: Celtic Connections
programme.desc: A Canadian trio perform one of their tunes Before My Time, which mixes traditional folk with a trance-folk beat

programme.title: Cidsin Granaidh Chalanais
programme.desc: Gregor MacLeod takes on the classics shortbread and marmalade. Grannie has five recipes for shortbread alone, but Gregor has to pick just one

programme.title: Seirm
programme.desc: Mary Ann Kennedy presents the lightning-fast playing of traditional pop band Mec Lir as well as fiddle and banjo music from Allison de Groot and Tatiana Hargreaves. Plus, singer-songwriter Beth Malcolm and new Gaelic songs from Rachel Walker and Aaron Jones

programme.title: Tuaman Na h-Eiphit/Tombs of Egypt
programme.desc: Two-part documentary following a team of Egyptian scientists who, during a three-month excavation in Saqqara, unearthed a completely intact burial complex deep under the sand at the foot of the pyramid of King Teti. Filled with treasures and exceptional artifacts, the site offers huge potential for Egyptologists

programme.title: Dealbh is Slighe
programme.desc: Calum Maclean heads to Applecross in Wester Ross, travelling from the edge of the sea to the top of hills to catch that special photo

programme.title: Tatu Rioghail Dhun Eideann (The Edinburgh Military Tattoo)
programme.desc: Carrie MacNeil celebrates the return of the Royal Edinburgh Military Tattoo for the first time since 2019, with Jennifer Reoch talking to some of those taking part. Joining the world-famous Massed Pipes and Drums in the theme of 'Voices' is an array of performers from across the globe, including the Top Secret Drum Corps, Banda Monumental de Mexico, the New Zealand Army Band, plus the US Air Force Drill Team and for the first time, the Highland Divas and the US Army Field Band

programme.title: Feisean Ciuil 2020

programme.title: ALT

programme.title: Baile na h-Ola

Boom times were ahead - followed by economic crashes and tragic disasters

programme.title: State of Happiness
programme.desc: It is December 1969 and international oil companies are pulling out of Stavanger in Norway after years of test drilling without success. Christian Nyman works as a diver on one of the rigs, while Toril Torstensen's American boyfriend works for Shell, but what happens next affects everyone in town. Starring Anne Regine Ellingsaeter, Amund Harboe, Toril Torstensen and Bart Edwards. In Norwegian and English
