programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The air ambulance is dispatched to collect Frances, an 80-year-old woman who fell three metres into her empty swimming pool while gardening, and has sustained a head wound that could have resulted in a life-altering bleed on the brain. Ruth, aged 86, arrives at St George's A&E with her heart beating three times faster than the normal rate. Doctors are concerned it may not be pumping enough blood around her body, and quickly prescribe fast-acting medication. Plus, students Jerry and Sakille turn up at the hospital after Jerry crashed her car on the way home from a party. While Jerry stayed sober to serve as the designated driver, she concludes that balancing a full-time job with her studies and a hectic social life might not be a sensible idea

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: While renovating a new bridal bedroom, Julia battles cracked plaster and expensive surprises. Anna and Edward get creative with the candles left over from weddings in a bid to save money. At Chateau Gioux, Debbie and Nigel bring new life to an old piano by creating a vibrant gin bar

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: It's the height of the season for the expats chasing a new life abroad. In Portugal, the brewery opens its tap room, and there's a launch party at the B&B in Andalusia. A swimming pool gets delivered to the French spa, and an event starts in the dark at the yurt restaurant in Italy

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The season reaches its end for the intrepid expats. In France, a spa owner crowns her business dream as she throws open her doors for the first time. In Portugal, there's an unexpected dip in the number of customers for a couple of brewery owners, while in Spain an unexpected booking causes chaos at a countryside B&B

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first venue of the week is Daisy Bank Camp in Hebden Bridge, Yorkshire, where guests take a trip to a local conservation farm and enjoy a locally sourced breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers visit Katie and Jess' The Lion and Swan in Congleton, Cheshire and while first impressions are good, the cracks soon begin to show as Andrew and Angie are driven insane by the traffic and Emma is unimpressed by the price tag at breakfast. With plenty of grumbles from their guests, will Katie and Jess be pleased with their feedback?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Visit three is to The Three Hills, Cambridge. Hosts Emma and Emily are hoping the award-winning food will be enough to guarantee their success but things get off to a rough start with some cleanliness concerns. After an afternoon out punting and a brilliant breakfast, the hosts feel confident but their joy is short lived when the feedback comes in

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Darren and Jamie look to lay on a magical experience for the B&Bers in the week's final visit, at their wizard-themed Hotel of Wizardry in Great Yarmouth. The guests are certainly spellbound by the hotel's quirks to begin with, but the magic soon wears off when they find that not everything is quite as it should be

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Angie and Andrew from Daisy Bank Camp want to shed a light on some facilities faults, The Lion and Swan's Katie and Jess pour cold water over some kettle confusion, while Emma and Emily from The Three Hills want two B&Bers in particular to open up on their comments about a lack of space. After the dust has settled, they then learn the identity of the winner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Angela and Steve from Leicestershire have been to Lanzarote on holiday more than 100 times, and now they want to realise their long-held dream of owning a holiday home in the Playa Blanca area, which Angela hopes that they can move to permanently once Steve retires. Jasmine Harman shows them five properties within their budget of 225,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Godsisters Roselyn Fleary and Jennifer Lawrence from London have always been best friends and holiday together every year on the Caribbean island of Grenada. As they both have family roots on the island they are now looking for a holiday home that could one day be a full-time retirement location. With a budget of 250,000 Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties, but can she tick all of their boxes?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Elaine and Patrick Scott from Lancaster are both history buffs with a passion for the 1940s, and want to move permanently to Normandy in France. Drawn by rich culture and history, they're after a home in the Manche area. Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their 140,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Russell Lovatt from Nottingham has been visiting Malta for the last 40 years. Now, with help from his daughter Sian, he is looking for the perfect property for a complete relocation, but they have very different opinions about what sort of home Russell should buy. With a budget of 200,000, can Laura Hamilton find a property with the wow factor to impress them both?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Rosemarie Clarke and Jeff John from London are looking for the perfect holiday home on the Caribbean island of St Lucia. Rosemarie was born in Jamaica, while Jeff's family are from St Lucia. Danni Menzies shows them five properties for their budget of 175,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Music therapist Sarah Hadley from Surrey has a long-term love affair with the Greek island of Crete, a place she and her best friend Sue Williams have been visiting together for years. Now, Sarah is after her perfect Cretan holiday home and has asked Sue to help her with the decision. Jasmine Harman shows them five incredible properties for a budget of 150,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Salsa-loving couple Colin Charles and Joy Walker cannot wait to buy a holiday home on the popular Costa Blanca. However, the pressure is really on for Ben Hillman to get it right, as it's the first time the couple have brought a property together. For their budget of 200,000, can Ben Hillman deliver the perfect property in the perfect location and do they make an offer?

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: The hosts look back on some renovation conundrums, mainly, whether to extend or move somewhere new completely. Gloria and Tom were torn between moving or renovating, and more importantly, how would they build upon their home if they couldn't find somewhere else to go. In Harrow, Ash and Tanjeet had completely run out of space. While their fridge was in the hallway next to the front door, their two teenage children shared one bedroom that doubled as an office for the family business

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: George is in West Yorkshire to check out a building with a criminal past - a former police station - which comes complete with original holding cells and a 1980s reception area. Rachel, who runs her own fashion business, is determined to do most of the work herself. Fortunately, her boyfriend Mike is a builder. Will they be able to transform it into a spectacular home?

programme.title: The Great Celebrity Bake Off for Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding welcome AJ Odudu, Gemma Collins, Jessica Hynes and Tim Key to the tent for the second of this year's star-studded special editions for the charity campaign. programme.title: Tempting Fortune
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness challenges a group of 12 strangers to make a gruelling trek across 18 miles of the South African wilderness - and resist a series of temptations along the way. The party starts out with a prize fund of 300,000 to be shared at the end of the journey, but each time one of them cracks, the money goes down

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Two-part special following the case of a naked man found stabbed to death in Luton, which leads police to discover this may be one of a series of murders in which men are lured with the promise of sex, so that they can be robbed. DI Dale Mepstead turns her attention to two men who are seen on CCTV accompanying the suspects into a flat. Will either of the women being held in custody reveal their identity?

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.desc: Through interviews with ex-inmates, retired guards and relatives of Britain's most infamous inmates, this documentary uncover secrets of life inside one of the UK's toughest jails. However, when the Japanese launch a bombing raid on a US base in Hawaii, the three of them have to put aside their personal problems. Romantic drama, starring Ben Affleck, Josh Hartnett, Kate Beckinsale and Cuba Gooding Jr

programme.title: Django Unchained (2012)
programme.desc: A slave named Django is tracked down by eccentric German bounty hunter Dr King Schultz, who offers him his freedom in exchange for help bringing three criminals to justice. The unlikely allies continue their partnership after the job is done, and fight to rescue Django's wife from a sadistic plantation owner. Quentin Tarantino's Oscar-winning Western, starring Jamie Foxx, Christoph Waltz, Leonardo DiCaprio and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Catching up with tenants and landlords from previous episodes, including a man living in a damp and mouldy flat, who was unable to sleep in the bedroom due to the horrendous conditions. The programme also revisits a 70-year-old landlady whose tenants stopped paying the rent for a year, and the council's Rogue Landlord Team in Lewisham, who learned where a slum property owner's reputation for a short fuse came from

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Kellie owes five months' rent, but refuses to leave unless the bailiffs arrive, while Simon wanted to sell his house post-breakup, but the tenants are still there five years later, and Arvydas is happily living in his garden shed

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A landlord seeks urgent advice from eviction specialist Chris after finding his three-bedroom terrace has been stripped bare of the fittings, the flooring, and even the grass on the lawn. Landlady Rose gets a shock when she finally gains access to her property, and Dave from Peterborough Council's housing team comes across some of the worst damp and mould he has ever seen. Plus, Selina and Lee must return from America for a court case to recover 10,000 rent arrears on their UK property

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Kate faces trouble from unruly tenants, who became anti-social, and are now trying to sue her for serving them an eviction notice. Dhiren relates how the existing tenant of a house he bought stopped paying rent as soon as he took ownership, and Tim explains how a health scare left him seeking to sell his property - but a standing occupant refused to leave

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Claire and Simon seek eviction specialist Chris's help to evict a man claiming to be renting their old family home. Meanwhile, Hamza hopes to get his council flat back after he tried to help a neighbour's friend by letting them stay for a week, but ended up being shut out when they refused to leave. Plus, a man is almost 30,000 in debt and in danger of repossession after his tenants stopped paying the rent

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: North Yorkshire officers are called out to a massive crash near a theme park that has resulted in the death of at least one person. The need to understand what has happened and who - if anyone - is to blame tests the resources of all the traffic cops who attend and then investigate this fatal incident. Will their gut instincts that this is a drug-fuelled disaster prove correct?

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston presents an edition focusing on the hunt for disqualified, unlicensed and uninsured drivers. In Bradford, officers from the West Yorkshire Safer Roads team pursue a desperate and disqualified driver through the city streets, while a member of the public is forced into making a citizen's arrest when another banned motorist attempts to flee the scene of a crash. In York, a pensioner is knocked down in a hit-and-run incident and an urgent search for the culprit gets under way

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: North Yorkshire is considered a soft touch by criminals, who using the county's rural back roads to operate under cover of darkness. In this edition, the team's elite officers hunt down and arrest burglars, drug dealers and thieves. Jamie Theakston narrates

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers have to deal with the consequences of cars hitting cyclists and pedestrians. In York, traffic cops need all their professionalism to deal with a distressing situation when a pregnant bike rider is knocked off her bike by a lorry, while a pedestrian in Leeds has been hit by a driver who appears to have used their car as a weapon. But does CCTV footage show the whole story? Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team carries out a raid that turns up a stash of drugs, a weapon and a large pile of cash, while Jon Peacock is amazed to encounter a half-naked man covered in blood on the wintry streets of Lincoln, but the real surprise comes when the officer finds out what he has been up to. Suspicious driving leads Jim Woolerton to discover super-strength lager and drugs, and a speeding motorist comes out with a very middle-class excuse after being clocked travelling at 110mph

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Dan Brigginshaw tracks down a driver who has given him the slip on the side roads of Spalding, while Suzie Ranyard comes to the rescue of a motorist with a rather large passenger. Jim Woolerton utilises some of the unit's most advanced kit to catch out a disqualified driver and officers are called out when a dead body is spotted in one of Lincolnshire's many waterways

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The dog unit embarks on a desperate manhunt amid fears that an armed and dangerous character is roaming the streets of Lincoln, while Craggy closes in on a suspected shoplifter with a bag full of surprises. Officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit also tackle a would-be stunt rider and a boozed-up biker who is raising hell on the A-roads

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A case of drink-driving leads to a hot pursuit on the city streets and carnage on the country roads, while a routine stop for speeding gives a lone female officer a worrying surprise. As devastating storms batter the UK, the helicopter crew is called out to rescue a woman trapped by deadly rising river water

programme.title: Evil Up Close: Kids Who Kill
programme.desc: The case of Mathew Hardman, dubbed the 'vampire killer', who thought that by taking a life he would become immortal. He stabbed an elderly neighbour to death, removed her heart and drank her blood

programme.title: Maxine
programme.desc: As the police investigation intensifies, Maxine Carr becomes increasingly drawn into the media frenzy as Ian helps with the search. When Maxine organises for herself and Ian to do a live television interview, she risks her own alibi when someone she met in Grimsby on the night of the girls' disappearance sees her on TV. Fact-based drama, starring Jemma Carlton and Scott Reid

programme.title: Swipe, Match, Murder: The Murder of Grace Millane
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of how the killer of the British backpacker was brought to justice after she was murdered by Jesse Kempson in New Zealand in December 2018 after they arranged a date on Tinder. The first instalment follows the initial police investigation and the examination of hours of CCTV footage featuring Grace and Kempson that tracked their every move on the night they met

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene
programme.desc: How light source technology and fibre analysis led to the conviction of murderer Stephen Marshall, who dismembered his victim and scattered the body parts across Hertfordshire

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Footage of a shopkeeper who fought back against a robber armed with a knife, and footage of fights inside pubs and outside clubs

programme.title: Don't Tell the Doctor
programme.desc: Dr Jonathan Hazon, Dr Tamara Cohen, Dr Khizar Mahmood and Dr Belinda Fenti come to the rescue of men and women who have made their medical problems worse by self-diagnosing them online

programme.title: Dogs with Incredible Jobs
programme.desc: Documentary featuring dogs with unusual skills

Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a marine off the coast of Tanzania - a case complicated by the discovery that he had a link to Ziva. The mystery deepens even further with the recovery of wreckage from a sunken freighter. Starring Mark Harmon, Cote de Pablo, David McCallum, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents investigate the Halloween murder of a marine with a fondness for playing practical jokes. As the evidence accumulates, they begin to suspect he was killed by the exasperated victim of one of his pranks. Drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Cote de Pablo, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Assistant DAs McCoy and Kincaid put their careers on the line in search of the truth behind the death of a wealthy woman. Meanwhile, detectives question the victim's first and second husbands, and her teenage daughter

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A routine investigation brings to light evidence that prompts Briscoe and Logan to pick up the trail of a political fugitive who went underground following a 1971 burglary that left a police officer dead. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Lt Van Buren is mugged by two teenagers, but the hold-up does not go according to plan and the officer discharges her weapon, killing one of the youngsters with a shot to the back. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A gay city councillor is shot dead after a meeting, and the trail of suspicion leads the team to a bigoted rival politician and a male prostitute. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and his new partner Ray Curtis investigate the murder of a girl who disappeared after school, and the trail of clues begins with blurry footage of her capture recorded by an ATM machine's camera. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt

programme.desc: Tensions are high between new partners Briscoe and Curtis as they investigate the murder of a wealthy student in a biker bar. The detectives discover the victim's father had offered him $10,000 to drop his hobby and his biker girlfriend. Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt star

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A reporter for the Navy Times is found stabbed to death - and the team learns he had been going to meet a call girl linked to three other murders. Gibbs decides to ask former madam Holly Snow for help in tracking her down. Crime drama, guest starring Dina Meyer (Saw), with Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An NCIS polygraph specialist comes under suspicion when a murder occurs while he is moonlighting, and the agents step in to determine whether their colleague is responsible. Naval crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A navy lieutenant's car careers off the road and he is found to have been murdered behind the wheel. NCIS is called in to investigate and Tony becomes obsessed with finding the victim's sister, a well-known TV reporter whose disappearance is seemingly linked to the case - and several others. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Mark Harmon

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a mutilated body is found in a car at a scrapyard, the NCIS agents find themselves trying to locate a serial killer. Meanwhile, Abby and McGee head to Mexico and investigate the 20-year-old mystery of a drug dealer's murder. Their actions attract the attention of the head of a local drug cartel, and links begin to emerge between their case, the serial killings and Gibbs's past

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler investigates an assault case involving his former partner's teenage son, who assaulted a female friend during a drug-induced rage. However, the conflict between the detective's work and personal life pushes him to the verge of a breakdown and jeopardises the squad's reputation. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives examine the deaths of two gay men, both of whom were labelled as 'killers' by their murderer. CCH Pounder guest stars, with BD Wong, Dann Florek and Diane Neal

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A man is accused of murdering two Arab-Americans - but his attorney mounts a novel defence, claiming he was compelled to kill because he is genetically predisposed toward hatred and violence. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A local fisherman gets involved in shady dealings. When he goes on the run, Jessica finds herself mixed up with dodgy detective Charlie Garrett, who has arrived to investigate. Angela Lansbury stars, with Wayne Rogers, Matt Mulhern and William Windom

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica's editor is found dead, having apparently committed suicide, but the amateur sleuth remains unconvinced and sets out to uncover the truth. Angela Lansbury stars, with Dennis Boutsikaris and Robert Desiderio

programme.desc: Part one of two. A serial killer disrupts the team members' holiday plans by taunting them with clues that might help them save his next victim. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

A suspect is eventually arrested - but Munch is shot during the ensuing trial. Starring Richard Belzer and Ice-T

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Building workers at a playground find the remains of a boy who disappeared more than 20 years previously, and when Stabler visits the school attended by the victim, a teacher tells him about the disappearance of four Puerto Rican children in 1978. As he investigates, a link is made to a case being worked on by lab technician Millie Vizcarrondo

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A teenage runaway is sought in connection with the murder of her neurotic, overbearing mother - but Benson feels there are mitigating circumstances, and enlists the help of a prominent children's right's lawyer to establish what really happened

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Logan suspect a missing infant may have been killed by her parents rather than kidnapped, and their inquiries lead them to uncover a terrible family secret relating to a mentally ill serial killer. Award-winning police drama, starring Chris Noth and Jerry Orbach

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A psychiatrist having an affair with a patient murders his wife with his lover's help. However, while he establishes the perfect alibi he soon finds himself pursued by Columbo, whose meandering investigative approach conceals an uncanny gift for detection. First episode of the detective series, starring Peter Falk and Gene Barry

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: An ambitious senatorial candidate murders his campaign manager for threatening to expose his secret affair. To avoid suspicion, the politician makes the killing look as if he was the intended target of an assassination attempt that went wrong - but ends up having to pit his wits against the slovenly sleuth. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Jackie Cooper, Ken Swofford and Tisha Sterling

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A compulsive gambler with a mountain of debts comes up with a plan to make some easy money. He plants a bomb under his wealthy uncle's car in the hope of inheriting a large legacy - but a hit-and-run driver jeopardises the entire scheme and Columbo is soon sniffing around for clues. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Tyne Daly, Greg Evigan and Don S Davis

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A London theatre producer discovers his actress wife is having an affair with her co-star in their latest production. To avoid exposure, the pair murder him and make it look as if his death was an accident. Meanwhile, Columbo is in the city to pick up some tips from Scotland Yard, and sets about uncovering the truth. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Honor Blackman, Richard Basehart and Wilfrid Hyde White

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A scientist is overjoyed when his son follows in his footsteps, receiving widespread acclaim for a revolutionary new theory. When a fellow boffin produces evidence of plagiarism, the ruthless father resorts to murder to save his son from a scandal. But he reckons without the dishevelled detective, who sees through his efforts to make the killing look like the work of burglars. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Jose Ferrer and Lew Ayres

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The owner of an American football team is found dead in a swimming pool, and his drowning is regarded as an accident. The down-at-heel detective is convinced that foul play was involved and sets out to prove his case - but his chief suspect has a cast-iron alibi that places him miles away from the scene of the crime. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk and Robert Culp

programme.title: Murder in the First
programme.desc: Drama following homicide detectives Terry English and Hildy Mulligan, as they investigate two seemingly unconnected murders that share a common denominator. In the opening episode, the officers are shocked to find that the death of a drug addict may have a connection to a young tech genius named Erich Blunt. Starring Taye Diggs, Kathleen Robertson and Tom Felton

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson goes undercover to meet a man suspected of raping three women he met through a speed-dating service. The case takes on a new complexity when the suspect's wife drinks herself into a coma after testifying against him, and he asks for her feeding tube to be turned off - against the wishes of her mother. Guest starring Dean Cain, Veronica Cartwright and Teri Garr

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A pregnant teenager is attacked and loses her baby as a result of the injuries she sustains - but during the team's search for her assailant, it gradually becomes clear that she helped to orchestrate events. Novak and Branch realise her boyfriend was also involved, but disagree over the appropriate action to take against him. Starring Diane Neal and Fred Dalton Thompson

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.desc: An autistic man dies in police custody, and when Briscoe and Logan investigate, they discover he was receiving a number of unusual and illegal treatments. The inquiry also sheds light on the deceased's parents, who seem reluctant to pursue a prosecution

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness the best and worst behaviour on the nation's busiest motorway

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Bino & Fino
programme.desc: What are the planets of the Solar System? Bino and Fino get to find out with the help of Zeena the Magical Butterfly!

programme.title: Bino & Fino
programme.desc: Bino and Fino learn about the water cycle.

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Ways to School
programme.desc: They climb up mountainous paths, swim across rivers or fight their way through icy wastelands. Travelling through amazing natural landscapes, they are simply students on their way to school

programme.title: Europe's Wilderness
programme.desc: A journey of discovery to a wonderful world of breath-taking views and endangered species with each episode focusing on one animal and its lifestyle, needs and habitat

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: An RAF clerk returns from the war to find his house in ruins - destroyed not by German bombs, but by his wife forgetting to turn off the gas

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: The singleton hopes the seaside town of Torquay holds the key to his dreams

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: A Londoner is helped in their grief process by an opera singer

programme.title: The Bulldog Breed (1960)
programme.desc: A bumbling grocer is rejected by the woman of his dreams, plunging him into misery. He decides to get over his heartbreak by joining the Navy, and despite his ineptitude, is selected by an admiral to become Britain's first astronaut. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Ian Hunter, David Lodge and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Clambake (1967)
programme.desc: A millionaire's son is determined to succeed on his own, so changes places with a poor water-skiing instructor to prove he can live without the perks of wealth. Musical, with Elvis Presley, Shelley Fabares, Bill Bixby and Will Hutchins

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: The singleton hopes the seaside town of Torquay holds the key to his dreams

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: Hsuan Tsang is named Tripitaka when he is selected to journey from China to India to find the Buddhist Holy Scriptures, with Monkey and a talking horse for company. Masoaki Sakai, Toshiyuki Nishida, Shiro Kishibe and Masako Natsume star

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Romantic drama, starring Martin Clunes and Julie Graham as lonely hearts looking for love. Undertaker William Shawcross joins a dating agency in the hope of finding his ideal match, and is instantly attracted to put-upon midwife Mary Gilcrest - but she is less than keen to go on a date as she has her hands full with a mother-to-be suffering from a terminal illness. After a lacklustre first meeting, Mary agrees to see William again and a spark ignites between the fledgling couple - only for tragedy to strike when her patient dies, and the undertaker is called in to remove the body, revealing his unappealing occupation in the process. With Dominick Baron, Ricci Mcleod, Cheryl Campbell and Michael Begley

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson realises Matthew is in love with Amelia and manipulatively tells him that he must continue his travels in America in order to win her love, while Bucket continues his investigation by turning his sights on Mr Barbary, who was seen with Marley on Christmas Eve. Elsewhere, Bill tries to take Nancy away from her work as a prostitute, but fails to meet Fagin's lofty price demands, and Mrs Gamp tells Silas a hair-raising story to persuade him not to live alone. Period drama re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens, starring Stephen Rea, Adrian Rawlins and Joseph Quinn

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Siobhan's boss introduces her to a new client who, much to her surprise, is the man she shared a secret liaison with two nights before. Although she says it was a one-off, it soon becomes clear he wants more than her professional legal services. Trudi grows suspicious of Richard's spending habits, Katie is confused in matters of the heart and newlywed Jessica looks for affection elsewhere. Orla Brady, Sharon Small, Sarah Parish and Shelley Conn star

programme.title: Perrier's Bounty (2009)
programme.desc: A man borrows money from a loan shark, but ends up with a price on his head when he cannot pay it back. In desperation, he joins a gang of thieves to raise the money, but when a simple robbery goes horribly wrong, finds himself with a second lot of crooks on his trail. Comedy thriller, starring Cillian Murphy, Brendan Gleeson and Jim Broadbent

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Relentless (2020)
programme.desc: An ex-convict must stay out of trouble for one more day to secure his freedom - but must choose between his principles and his future when he comes to the aid of a prostitute under threat from a gang. Action thriller, starring Steven Murphy and Tiffany-Ellen Robinson

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson realises Matthew is in love with Amelia and manipulatively tells him that he must continue his travels in America in order to win her love, while Bucket continues his investigation by turning his sights on Mr Barbary, who was seen with Marley on Christmas Eve. Period drama re-imagining the works of Charles Dickens, starring Stephen Rea, Adrian Rawlins and Joseph Quinn

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Cat-catchers Maggie and Jim attempt to round-up a colony of farm cats. However, the task proves harder than they imagined. Harley comes to the hospital for routine check-up, but Claire discovers a murmur. Elsewhere, Martina searches for an effective stress relief for her cat

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: The events of 30th June 1934, which became known as the Night of the Long Knives after SS forces murdered the SA leaders Hitler saw as a threat to him

programme.title: Keep Fit (1937)
programme.desc: A weedy barber tries to get into shape, and ends up challenging a brawny love rival to a boxing match. Musical comedy, starring George Formby and Kay Walsh

programme.title: North West Frontier (1959)
programme.desc: A British officer saves an Indian prince from an uprising and tries to escort him and the boy's nanny to safety on board a dilapidated train. However, his mission is jeopardised when it becomes clear there is a traitor on board, leading to a deadly game of cat and mouse. Action adventure, starring Lauren Bacall, Kenneth More, Herbert Lom and Wilfrid Hyde White

programme.title: The Cup (2011)
programme.desc: Australian jockey Damien Oliver prepares to follow in his father's footsteps and compete in the 2002 Melbourne Cup. However, the weeks leading up to the event are rocked by tragedy for both Oliver himself, who faces a death in the family, and for the nation in the wake of the Bali bombings. Fact-based drama, starring Stephen Curry and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: USA
programme.desc: Yellowstone is the oldest national park in the world, home to the world's highest concentration of geysers and thermal springs as well as herds of bison that roam the highlands

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six is accused of disrupting the ordered routine of the Village, and as punishment is subjected to a lobotomy experiment designed to determine if sound waves and drugs can alter a man's personality

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary meets opera singer Eugene Ginty and his miniature donkeys, and rat-breeder Laura Woods and her pets in Cork. Plus, staff at a canine creche celebrate a goldendoodle's birthday, and there's a look at the All-Ireland Cat Fancy Dress Competition in Dundalk

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert visits North Uist in the Outer Hebrides, where he goes scuba-diving to explore the underwater world of Loch nam Madadh, the largest saltwater feature of its kind on the island. Ray also admires the wildlife populating its shores, including diving and wading birds, sea eagles, red deer, otters and common seals

programme.title: Royals and Animals: Til Death Do Us Part
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the extraordinary relationship between the Windsor's and their animals

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The true nature of friendship within Cranford is revealed as the ladies rally to help Miss Matty when she receives terrible news. Meanwhile, Dr Harrison suffers as his career, reputation and relationship all seem ruined, while Miss Galindo and Mr Carter grow closer as they face up to the tragedy of Hanbury. Judi Dench, Philip Glenister and Simon Woods star

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Soho and Milllwall, with fascinating facts for locals and tourists alike. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: A Place of One's Own (1945)
programme.desc: An ageing couple move into a haunted house, where their companion becomes possessed by the spirit of a murdered girl. Ghost story, starring James Mason, Barbara Mullen, Margaret Lockwood, Dennis Price, Dulcie Gray and Michael Shepley

programme.title: Seance on a Wet Afternoon (1964)
programme.desc: A self-professed medium with a greed for money and publicity arranges the kidnap of a wealthy industrialist's daughter, with the intention of winning acclaim and the ransom when she locates the child using her alleged psychic powers. British psychological thriller, starring Kim Stanley, Richard Attenborough, Mark Eden, Nanette Newman, Gerald Sim and Judith Donner

programme.title: The Big Catch (1967)
programme.desc: A group of children tries to capture a wild horse with the aim of selling it to mend an old boat. Children's drama, starring David Gallacher and Ronald Sinclair

programme.title: Blackonomics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the UK's Afro-Caribbean community's relationship with money when it comes to education, investing and building general wealth

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The team revives humans from another planet who have been frozen for 300 years. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: The documentary follows Martin and Jennifer as they travel to rural Co Donegal for a five-star luxury break for both them and their dogs. Meanwhile, the budgies compete in the All-Ireland final, and there is the story of how a Great Dane bonded with a three-year-old girl who has epilepsy

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the South Downs, starting from Beachy Head, and examines some of the 39 species of butterfly recorded as using its chalk downlands as a habitat, including the Adonis blue. He also visits the supposedly haunted yew woodland at Kingley Vale nature reserve in West Sussex and comes across peregrine falcons and badgers

programme.title: The Grass Arena (1992)
programme.desc: Biopic of chess grandmaster and author John Healy. Raised by an abusive father in a heavily religious family, the young Healy turns to boxing to learn to defend himself. But as his sporting career falters, he finds himself struggling with alcoholism. Starring Mark Rylance and Pete Postlethwaite

programme.title: Eden Lake (2008)
programme.desc: A couple on a romantic break find their peace shattered by a gang of youths who steal their belongings and vandalise their car. However, when they confront the youngsters they are subjected to a horrific attack, resulting in a deadly game of cat and mouse through the woodland. Horror, starring Kelly Reilly and Michael Fassbender

programme.title: My Left Foot (1989)
programme.desc: Biopic of Irish writer and artist Christy Brown, who had cerebral palsy leaving him unable to control most of his body. Born into a large, poor family, Christy is disregarded as a hopeless case by the medical establishment, but encouraged by his devoted mother as he learns to write and draw with his left foot. Starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis and Brenda Fricker

programme.desc: Tottenham Hotspur v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). Live coverage of the match at Brisbane Road, as the title-chasing Gunners travel to their North London rivals looking for three important points. The home side have struggled this season, and they sacked manager Rehanne Skinner in mid-March after taking just nine points from their first 14 matches this season. Their first game without Skinner, however, ended in a 1-0 win against Leicester City
